summary: Olive E. Wagner was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents detail her employment, salary, and pay during different periods within 1978. The documents do not specify her exact role within the HSCA, but her presence on payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Olive E. Wagner's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination. The documents confirm her role as a staff member through payroll records.
